Issues.Title: Convert Rest of IRawElementProviderX to Cswin32
Issues.Body:
Converts `IRawElementProviderFragmentRoot` and `IRawElementProviderHwndOverride` to Cswin32. Each conversion is separated into its own commit.  Note that we do not currently return anything from `IRawElementProviderHwndOverride.GetOverrideProviderForHwnd` aside from null so I've added a commit to remove the corresponding virtual method in separate commit.

Tested manually with Narrator and AccessibilityInsights.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10334)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Convert Rest of IRawElementProviderX to Cswin32" (#10334)

Issues.Title: Move && and || to front of lines
Issues.Body:
This changes some of the code (primarily DataGrid) to match the desired code style with line breaking on long logical statements.

To align conceptually the logical operators should be at the beginning of the line when breaking long statements.

When considering how to break lines, logical conditions grouped by a specific set of parentheses should either all be broken out into separate lines or kept together on a single line. To show nesting, statements should be indented to match the parenthetical nesting, but parentheses should not get their own line.

Some examples:

``` C#
if (_trackColumn != previousColumnIndex
    && !(previousColumnIndex == -1 && hti._col == _trackColumn)
    && (dataGridViewColumnNext is null || _trackColumn != dataGridViewColumnNext.Index))
```

And:

``` C#
if (Focused
    && !IsCurrentCellInEditMode
    && (EditMode == DataGridViewEditMode.EditOnEnter
        || (EditMode != DataGridViewEditMode.EditProgrammatically && CurrentCellInternal.EditType is null)))
```

In general, if pattern matching is suggested by the IDE it should be used. `or` and `and` should go to the front of the line as well.

This change also adds a helper for invoking events on `DataGrid`.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10333)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Move && and || to front of lines" (#10333)

Issues.Body: Hi everyone, as we enter the holiday season please expect delayed responses on issues and PRs until early January as some WinForms members are taking time off. Thank you!

Issues.Title: Always Query for IUnknown when Comparing AgileComPointer for Identity
Issues.Body:
Fixes #10261

When obtaining a COM pointer to an object that was created on a different thread, we get a proxy so we cannot just directly compare for identity like we had been doing with maintaining `_originalObject` in `AgileComPointer`. If we want to know identity, we need to register the COM pointers in the GIT, query for the IUnknowns on the _same_ thread, and then compare the values.

As a consequence of this, updated `GetHashCode()` on HTMLX. We can no longer get the hashcode the same manner we were doing so before (getting the interface and using the value) because it would change depending on the thread if we had an AgileComPointer created from a proxy. So, we will now get the initial value of the `AgileComPointer` and use that for the hash code to make it constant. 

Added a regression test for this specific scenario that issue outlines, but also added a general test to categorize this a bit more in `AgileComPointerTest` - this test was failing before changes.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10318)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Always Query for IUnknown when Comparing AgileComPointer for Identity" (#10318)

Issues.Title: RichTextBox Find method throws exception when searching at end of RTF containing a table.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Not in .NET 6 nor 7. Others not tested.

### Issue description

When trying to use the `Find` method with just a `String` argument to find a string near the end of the document of a `RichTextBox` which's RTF contains a table, an `ArgumentOutOfRangeException` is thrown: `Index and length must refer to a location within the string. (Parameter 'length')`.

If the RTF is only normal text the method works as expected.
If it contains a table, even if it's not the last thing in the RTF, it throws the exception.
If the text doesn't occur in the document at all, nothing happens, as expected.

The last fact leads me to believe the problem lies in the selection of a found string, not in finding its starting index itself.

#### The stack trace:
```
System.Private.CoreLib
   at System.String.ThrowSubstringArgumentOutOfRange(Int32 startIndex, Int32 length)
   at System.String.Substring(Int32 startIndex, Int32 length)
   at System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBox.Find(String str, Int32 start, Int32 end, RichTextBoxFinds options)
   at System.Windows.Forms.RichTextBox.Find(String str)
   at Test.Form1.Button4_Click(Object sender, EventArgs e) in C:\Test\Test\Form1.vb:line 28
```


### Steps to reproduce

* Create a WinForms application using .NET 8.
* Create a form `Form1` with at least a `RichTextBox` (RTB).
* Create a RTF string which contains a table and let the RTB display it.
* Use the `Find` method on the RTB to find a string which lies near the end of the document.
* An exception is thrown.

#### Example:
```vbnet
Public Class Form1
    Private Sub Button1_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click
        Dim rtf As String = "{\rtf1\ansi\deff0\trowd
\pard\intbl Test\cell Example\cell Meow\cell Woof\cell \row
}"
        RichTextBox1.Rtf = rtf
    End Sub

    Private Sub Button2_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button2.Click
        Dim rtf As String = "{\rtf1\ansi\deff0
\pard Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec maximus nibh est, ut rutrum magna facilisis eget. Sed eget risus a purus sagittis suscipit. Mauris ut risus et ligula mollis pretium. Donec volutpat finibus eleifend. Ut molestie sit amet felis eget sollicitudin. Nunc odio nisl, fermentum at orci eget, tempor gravida ligula. Duis porta faucibus fringilla. Nam ut semper nisl. Example.\par
}"
        RichTextBox1.Rtf = rtf
    End Sub

    Private Sub Button3_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button3.Click
        Dim rtf As String = "{\rtf1\ansi\deff0\trowd
\pard\intbl X\cell X\cell X\cell X\cell\row 
\pard\intbl Test\cell Example\cell Meow\cell Woof\cell\row 
\pard Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Donec maximus nibh est, ut rutrum magna facilisis eget. Sed eget risus a purus sagittis suscipit. Mauris ut risus et ligula mollis pretium. Donec volutpat finibus eleifend. Ut molestie sit amet felis eget sollicitudin. Nunc odio nisl, fermentum at orci eget, tempor gravida ligula. Duis porta faucibus fringilla. Nam ut semper nisl. Test. Example.\par
}"
    End Sub

    Private Sub Button4_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button4.Click
        RichTextBox1.Rtf = RichTextBox1.Rtf
        Try
            RichTextBox1.Select()
            RichTextBox1.Find(InputBox(""))
        Catch ex As ArgumentOutOfRangeException
            MsgBox(ex.Message)
        End Try
    End Sub
End Class
```

* When using `Button1` to generate a table in the RTB and trying to find "Woof", the exception is thrown.
* When trying to find "Meow" there, it works as expected, "Meow" is selected.
* When using `Button2` to generate a normal text in the RTB and trying to find "Example.", it also works as expected.
* When using `Button3` to generate a table followed by "normal" text and trying to find "Example.", it throws the exception again.
* When trying to find "Test." there, it again works as expected.
* When using any of the buttons and trying to find something like "xxxxx", nothing happens, as expected, no exception.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "RichTextBox Find method throws exception when searching at end of RTF containing a table." (#10322)

Issues.Title: Verify that the drop source target window is in-process
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #8903 

## Proposed changes

- Fix the tracking of the last drop target window in `DragLeaveTarget`.
- Notify the drag-image manager during `DragLeaveTarget` that the cursor has left the target window only if it is in-process.
- Exclude the `GiveFeedbackEventArgs` `Effect` property from the check for if the drag image has been updated.
- Check if the target window is in-process and if not, prevent the drag image from being updated during `GiveFeeback`.
- Add and check for additional drag and drop data formats used to detect when the data object is in a drag loop.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- Fixes a drag image flicker and artefact that occurs when dragging and dropping cross-process.

## Regression? 

- No.

## Risk

- 

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/5017479/f79c941a-6935-463a-97e7-df04c1344f78

### After

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/5017479/d5f6f04d-5367-4fc9-84e1-56d77b7abe96

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manual

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- 9.0.100-alpha.1.23511.2<!-- use `dotnet --info` -->

<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: .NET8 PerMonitorV2 issue with TableLayoutPanel, NumericUpDown and Label
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET8.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No


### Issue description

Demo program TestDpiV2 with one TableLayoutPanel and many Label, TextBox, NumericUpDown anchored controls:
[TestDpiV2.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13364120/TestDpiV2.zip)

DPI = 100%
![TestDpiV2_100](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/28147549/e1f1d7aa-fe1a-4f51-9287-082841eb6183)

DPI = 150%
![TestDpiV2_150](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/28147549/5d0f82ef-c938-479d-8f5d-6d642a8ee453)
With DPI = 150% one can see that the Label "Tooltip Description" is only shown as "Tooltip". All NumericUpDown controls are misaligned.

Here one can see a more complex application (RibbonTools):
DPI = 100%
![RibbonTools_100](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/28147549/5568a13b-f52d-487c-81fb-d33d7d5330a4)

DPI= 125%
![RibbonTools_125](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/28147549/f321791a-5b63-4d10-843e-8d6bb4ae710d)


### Steps to reproduce

Use this project and set different DPI for the screen.
[TestDpiV2.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13364120/TestDpiV2.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".NET8 PerMonitorV2 issue with TableLayoutPanel, NumericUpDown and Label" (#10310)

Issues.Title: Tabpage should not be moved in the DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0.100-alpha.1.23564

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

It also repro's in .NET 8.0.

### Issue description

In [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app of Winforms repo, tabpage shoud not be moved.

**Actual result** in [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app:

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/61c945b7-b584-478b-a981-7638e738db0e

**Expected result:**
Tabpage shoud not be moved.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/c4c33a64-99bc-44e9-bfb6-da7d3cfc46cd





### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tabpage should not be moved in the DemoConsole application" (#10307)

Issues.Title: Issue 5761 normalize runtime id to base
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #5761 


## Proposed changes

- Unifies the identical implementation of the `RuntimeId` from various controls to base.RuntimeId of `ControlAccessibleObject`.


<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- None

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before
